definition: to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to

sentences.english: Please present identifications to purchase concession tickets.
sentences.chinese: 购买优待票请出示证件。

sentences.english: Television is available in each of the hotel rooms as an extra.
sentences.chinese: 旅馆每个房间都有电视机作为额外优待。

sentences.english: Nowadays its keystone is to treat the police with true feelings.
sentences.chinese: 现阶段从优待警的侧重点是以情待警。

sentences.english: In the Reagan era, well-connected Republicans received favoured treatment in this organization.
sentences.chinese: 的共和党人在这个机构中多受到了优待。
只有商家的优待券是不够的。

sentences.english: But politicians on both sides of the congressional aisle have complained about the Pentagon escaping this stringency.
sentences.chinese: 但是国会两院都抱怨五角大楼受到了特别优待。

sentences.english: Small firms have also been coddled by the government.
sentences.chinese: 小公司同样也受到政府的优待。

sentences.english: This coupon admits two people for free.
sentences.chinese: 这张优待券可供两人免费使用。

sentences.english: Do you have any seats at a student rate?
sentences.chinese: 你们有任何学生优待票吗？

sentences.english: I''d like to buy an excursion pass instead.
sentences.chinese: 我要买一张优待票代替。

sentences.english: Senior Citizen Stored Value Ticket must be used together with Preferential Card.
sentences.chinese: 老年人储值票须与《广州市老年人优待证》同时使用。

sentences.english: They said that what the demonstrators wanted was not democracy, but superiority.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为示威者想要的并非民主，而是优待。

sentences.english: I'd like to buy an excursion ticket instead.
sentences.chinese: 我想买一张优待票代替。

sentences.english: The president discriminates in favour of his relatives.

definition: to treat everyone equally favorably (idiom); not to discriminate between people
to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
(of an organization that has a duty of care) to give financial support to relatives of sb who has died or suffered serious injury
to take care/to keep an eye on/to look after/to tell/to remind
